name: Viceroy Santa Monica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our Viceroy stay and really enjoyed it. We got a great deal, so it's a borderline '5' for the price paid, but a '4' might be a stretch at the full rack rates compared to Shutters or the Casa del Mar. Our room had a nice view and large marble bathroom, the linens were of good quality, and the decor was fun. The only downside was the lack of closet space. Our dinner at Whist and all other food and drinks were very good. Service was fantastic from start to finish --- friendly, professional, efficient.
reviews.title: Overall...a Fantastic Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike other reviewers, I didn't experience any noise issues being on the front side of the hotel. The lobby, bar, and pool area basically become a club on weekend nights, which was fine with us but might not appeal to some travelers. You definitely notice the hotel's age in certain areas, but overall I thought it was kept up pretty well. The decor is great for a hotel stay, but I can't say that I'd want my house to look like this (sorry Kelly). I thought the $29 parking charge was rather steep and the fact that they charge for wireless internet in 2010 at a hotel of this level is tacky.
reviews.title: Nice, noisy, needs some TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When coming back to Santa Monica this summer, the Viceroy will definitely be on the short list of choices.
reviews.title: There is a reason why income statements have a line for depreciation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked into the hotel yesterday. Great first impression, the staff have been fantastic, incredibly helpful. Nice vibe and style which I don't think you'd get from any other hotels in the local area. On the downside we have a room on the sea front which is really noisy because of traffic. Also the room is tired and in need of some TLC. Could be an unfair statement, but we've just moved down from West Hollywood, previous to that NYC. By comparison both hotels there were immaculate and offered better value as a result. Hoping to move to a quieter room today, so the jury is still out, but fingers crossed the great service we experienced on arrival will prevail!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location
Best of Santa Monica
reviews.text: The good news - amazing location and the concierge was one of the best i have ever experienced. Every time we walked in the front door he greeted us. Highlight of the stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is nice, clean and the staff are helpful but it definitely had a pretentious feel about it that we did not warm too. Bed was really good. It is quite expensive as well. The valet parking is compulsory and cost $30 per night plus tips etc. we parked in the secure public parking garage for $5-10 per night and it is a 5 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Nice - but pretentious

reviews.text: I stayed at the Viceroy for work the weekend of the LA Marathon (which ended outside the hotel's doors). We stayed there for just one night, but I have to say I was a bit under-impressed by the hotel. I'd heard that the decor was amazing, but it all seemed a bit over designed. Our room was cute (nice wallpaper) but not really all that special in the layout. The service was mediocre and the restaurant was very overpriced for what you were getting. I wouldn't make an effort to return to the Viceroy. I think there are many more boutique hotels in LA with more personality.
reviews.title: Overly designed
typically trendy - a liitle sterile
reviews.text: nice location near beach in santa monica
typical "hip/slick/trendy" decor - lots of "style"
reviews.title: We booked this hotel after a...

reviews.text: but seen it all before elsewhere....
reviews.title: Hip, elegant and special

reviews.text: I celebrated a friend's 30th Birthday at this hotel and my expectations elegantly met!!! The room was beautiful and it had a spectacular view of the ocean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and my room was ready well before check in time. I was notified at soon as my room was available. All of the amenities of the hotel were top quality and the service was professional and met my expectations. I would revisit and recommend this hotel to anyone!! The design is also very well done!
reviews.title: A NIGHT TO REMEMBER!!

reviews.text: Stylish rooms are exactly as they seen on hotel photos. Service is great. It's not the cheap place so ready to pay a little bit more than in other places, but you diserve it...
reviews.title: Stylish place with great service

reviews.text: We arrived late on a Sunday evening after a long journey with pretty good expectations about the Viceroy. Everything looked great on the website and the reviews had been mostly positive. As we checked in though, first impressions weren't good. The guy behind the desk couldn't find any reservation details even though I had my confirmation with me. No apology or explanation but a room was eventually found and we were just glad that was that. When we put they key card in the door, though, a woman started shouting at us from inside the room....I turned the light on becuase I didn't know what was going on and turned it back off as quickly as possible when i realised we'd just woken two people who were asleep in the room....a quick 'sorry' as we closed the door was all I could say. At this point I was starting to wonder if this place was up to much since being sent into someone else's room (at night) is surely a big mistake for any hotel to make. We were met in reception by the guy who had checked us in...he rather abruptly took the wrong room key off us and gave us another one, simply saying 'that was the wrong room'. Again, no apology. Over the next few days, my overall impression of the hotel was: very nice rooms, clean hotel, nice location....but a serious 'attitude problem'......the focus seems to be on trendiness and little else. It took about 2 days for a note of apology to appear about the check-in incident and elsewhere things weren't much better. We ate in the restaurant one night and although the food was fine, our bill arrived without us asking for it and when our change came it was clear the bill had been 'rounded up' to the nearest dollar...neither of which struck me as good service. As if to sum up everything that's wrong with the Viceroy, when checking out we weren't asked anything about our stay. I don't mind paying a little extra to stay in a nice hotel, and this is certainly that, but when you're paying what this place charges, you expect good, friendly service. And that was certainly not to be found. When I got home a few weeks later I completed the hotel's detailed feedback form/survey (which I received by email) and gave them my contact details (a standard option). I can't say I was surprised that I didn't hear from the Viceroy.
reviews.title: a poor reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Viceroy seems to attract mixed reviews. We stayed for 2 nights and expected it to be the grand finale of our California trip... we left impressed by some elements of the design (the lobby and poolside cabanas specifically) but slightly disappointed overall considering the cost.
reviews.title: Our high expectations not quite met beyond the stunning lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is within walking distance of the busy 3rd Street Promenade and only a couple of minutes walk to the beach. But it is neither in the midst of the downtown action or right on the beach... many of its competitors are better located. We paid the lowest rate available so didn't expect an ocean view, but our room overlooked a parking lot. Still, everything we wanted to see in Santa Monica was fairly accessible from the hotel.
reviews.title: Trendy Stay and Great Service in Santa Monica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from the outside ...it's just a building but inside it's a paradise. great garden with swimming pool that is always crowded even in the evenings for parties.
reviews.title: amazing stay
Mother's Day at the Viceroy
reviews.text: great restaurant and quiet hotel...
you can relax. rooms are great and big.
reviews.title: If you're not pretty, and have kids, don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son who lives in Santa Monica invited me for Mother's Day weekend and suggested that I stay at the Viceroy Hotel. My daughter was meeting me there so I booked a room with two double beds. Shortly after booking my room, I received an e-mail from their concierge Sean offering to help me with any requests we might have. I requested an early check in as well as a room on a higher floor away from the pool due to the comments I had read about the noise level in the evenings due to the nightlife. I arrived in LA early on Saturday morning and called the hotel around 10:00AM. They said the room was ready and we could come and check in at any time. When we checked in, Sean remembered our correspondence and was quite friendly and helpful. After our complimentary glass of champagne at check in, we headed up to our room. The room was wonderful. I enjoy these boutique type of hotels and thought the decor was great! We headed down to the pool. The pool area is nice and sheltered from the wind off the ocean and we had a great afternoon out at the pool with drinks and appetizers. The service was great and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Viceroy. If you are sensitive to noise, bring some earplugs as you can hear the music from the pool area into the wee hours of the morning. I didn't have a problem sleeping but it kept my daughter up until it stopped around 2AM. We also had a cocktail in the lounge/bar on Saturday evening and really enjoyed the "vibe" at the Viceroy. I will definitely stay at the Viceroy on future visits to Santa Monica. Fabulous Mother's Day weekend, I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: We stayed here on our Wedding Night / Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are young, hip, and can hang with the cast of MTV's "The Hills," then this is your spot. If you're not, read on.....
reviews.title: Go here to treat yourself!

aka: Viceroy Santa Monica Hotel Santa Monica
description: An urban retreat at the shore - British impressions- with bold current perspectives. Business friendly- yet vacation ready- and just steps from the Santa Monica pier- beaches- shopping- dinning and nightlife. Each of the 162 guestrooms and suites offer ocean- pool- or palm views. Mascioni linens and bathrobes- custom beds with down comforters and pillows. Body and hair care products Aromatherapy Associates. In room spa services available- marble baths with seated vanities and soaking tubs- sitting areas- and fully stocked mini bars. In room entertainment centers feature 40 in flat screen tv- full cable access and movies- music- and video games- high-speed wireless Internet access- two-line telephones with speaker and private voicemail as well as media hubs. And dataports for modem/fax hookup - Viceroy also offers video check-out with e-mail reciept. A complete fitness center- 2 outdoor heated pools with private cabanas. Cameo bar- reunion dining at Cast- 24-hour room service- dry cleaning and laundry service- full-service concierge- choice of daily newspaper- and a 1300 sq foot meeting room with private patio overlooking the pool area.
